com.sana.android.plugin.application

Class CaptureManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sana.android.plugin.application.CaptureManager

  • public class CaptureManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The main helper class that facilitates data capturing from various sensing devices. You should use this class in most cases. Sample code snippets:
    1. Create an instance variable: 
                   
                 private CaptureManager captureManager;
    2. Optional: Implement your own data event listener. You can extend from existing listeners including DataChunkListener and TimedListener. If these classes don't meet your requirement, you can implement DataListener.
    3. Instantiate the captureManager instance variable in onCreate method. 
                   
                 protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
                     //...
                     captureManager = new CaptureManager(Feature.BLUETOOTH, MimeType.Audio, getContentResolver());
                     captureManager.addListener(new MyListener());// You have to call addListener before prepare
                     captureManager.prepare();
                     //...
                 }
      Additionally, if you need to pass additional or required capture setting, you can do this: 
                   
                 protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
                     //...
                     CaptureSetting captureSetting = new CaptureSetting();
                     // Do something with captureSetting
                     captureManager = new CaptureManager(Feature.BLUETOOTH, MimeType.Audio, getContentResolver(), captureSetting);
                     captureManager.addListener(new MyListener());// You have to call addListener before prepare
                     captureManager.prepare();
                     //...
                 }
    4. Call begin() and stop() at appropriate places. Here they are called in a button click listener. 
                   
                 public void recordButtonListener(View view) {
                     if (recording) {
                         captureManager.stop();
                         captureManager.reset();// You have to call reset before calling prepare again.
                         recording = false;
                     } else {
                         captureManager.begin();
                         recording = true;
                     }
                 }
    5. When data is ready to be sent to Sana, probably after some post processing, call CommManager.sendData(android.app.Activity). 
                   
                 CommManager.getInstance().sendData(this);

    • Constructor Detail

      • CaptureManager

        public CaptureManager(Feature source,
                      MimeType type,
                      android.content.ContentResolver contentResolver)

      • CaptureManager

        public CaptureManager(Feature source,
                      MimeType type,
                      android.content.ContentResolver contentResolver,
                      CaptureSetting setting)
        Create a CaptureManager that receives data of the specified MIME type and from the given Feature. The
        Parameters:
        source - The device feature from which data will come from.
        type - The MIME type of the data intended to be captured.
        setting - The setting to be passed to the sensor.

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        public void addListener(DataListener listener)
        Add a listener to the sensing device. Call this method if you wish to receive updates from the device. You can extend the existing DataChunkListener or TimedListener. The listening configuration can be modified in those classes.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener instance that is intended to receive updates.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(DataListener listener)
        Remove the listener. A listener may be added multiple times. This method will remove all of them.
        Parameters:
        listener -

      • prepare

        public void prepare()
        Prepare the sensing device for data capture. This method has to be called before calling the begin method. If before calling this method there has been another recording activity, the reset method must be called prior to this method. Otherwise an InvalidInvocationError will be thrown.

      • begin

        public void begin()
        Start sensing activity. If prepare is not called before calling this, an InvalidInvocationError will be thrown.

      • stop

        public DataWithEvent stop()
        Unlike prepare and begin. stop can be called anytime. However if there was no sensing activity before this, null will be returned.
        Returns:
        The data object that contains information of sensing result. Or null if no sensing activity has been initiated.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Unlike prepare and begin. reset can be called anytime. It simply reset the sensing device to the default state.

      • getDevice

        public GeneralDevice getDevice()
